result.execSummary:
The defendant Joshua S. Wright was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jackson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  If the defendant is placed on probation or released to extended supervision, IT IS ORDERED that the defendant pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.

Must seek and maintain employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.  Must obtain a GED or HSED.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with or be where any illegal drugs are used or sold.  Must have no contact with and drug users or dealers.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  
Must participate in and successfully complete the Jackson County Treatment Court program and follow all directives of Treatment Court Team.  Must not miss any appointments for any counseling or programming.  Must identify yourself as a Treatment Court participate if you have any contact with law enforcement, dentists, doctors or therapists.  You must submit to random drug testing when requested by your probation agent or the Treatment Court Team.  
Must apply for Badgercare or something similar to cover treatment costs.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge on all charges.
Must undergo an AODA assessment and participate in and successfully complete any recommended treatment or counseling.  Must follow all other recommendations of your probation agent and follow all Department of Corrections rules.

supervisions.notes:
AMENDED 10/24/17.  An additional 5 days of credit granted.
Concurrent with: Jackson County Case No. 14CT80, 15CF21, 15CF36 and Sauk County Case No. 15CF389.

superMiscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If reconfined or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Obtain and maintain employment, commensurate with his treatment needs.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent.

Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with extended supervision conditions.

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: Granting an additional 5 days credit
From Attorney Linehan to Judge Radtke

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Linehan.  Parties have the revocation packet.  State noted a correction on the 1st page 15CF389 is a Sauk County case.  Days of credit discussed.  State 189 days + 245 + 21 days for inpatient treatment.  Defense says 192 + 245 + 21 days.  State recommended: In 14CT80:  30 days jail. Time served.  In 15CF21 : 7 years total.  4 initial confinement & 3 yrs. extended supervision.  In 16CF36 and 16CF44:  4 years total.   2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent to each other, but consecutive to the Sauk County sentence. 

Defense recommended:   In 15CF21 : 4  years total. 2 initial confinement & 2 yrs. extended supervision.  Other cases same as probation agent's recommendation.   Concurrent to each other and the Sauk County sentence.  Defendant exercised his right to allocution.

Court ordered:  In 14CT80:  30 days jail. Time served.  In 15CF21 : 7 years total.  4 initial confinement &  3 years extended supervision.  In 16CF36 and 16CF44: 4 years total. 2  years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision. Concurrent to each other, and concurrent with the Sauk County sentence.   Felony warnings given.  
Defendant is eligible for the substance abuse program and the challenge incarceration program.    
Credit.  245 + 192 + 21.  Total 458.  
Extended supervision conditions:  AODA and recommended treatment.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.    Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Subject to random alcohol and drug testing by his agent.  Obtain and maintain employment commensurate with his treatment needs.

Further discussion on sentence credit.  Defense requesting an addition 275 days.  State will investigate. Parties to stipulate if possible.
Letter to Judge Radtke.   Sent to Judge Radtke this date.  JMM
emailed the revocation order and warrant and revocation summary to Judge Radtke and his JA.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant appears in person in custody with counsel Robert Gardner and Charles Betthauser (16CF44 only).  Gerald Fox appears for the State.  Will plea as follows:  15CT80 - plea to Ct 1; 15CF36 - plea to Ct 1, will DRI Ct 2; 15CM42 - will be DRI; 15CF21 - Plea to Ct 2, Cts 1, 3, 4, 5 will be DRI; 16CF44 - Plea to Cts 1 & 2, Counts 3 -7 will be DRI.  There are no victim interests in any of these cases.  16CF44:  Court reviews charges and potential penalties.  Understands charges, enhancer and penalties.  Count 1 - plea Guilty.  Court reviews elements.  Count 2 - plea of Guilty.  Correction by attorney Betthauser regarding minimum terms of correction.  DA Fox agrees.  15CF36:  Count 1 - understands charge and potential penalties; plea of Guilty.  Count 2 - will be DRI.  16CF21:  Court reviews Count 2 and potential penalties.  Understands charge and enhancer of Count 2 - plea of no contest after a correction made on plea form.  Counts 1, 3,4,5 will be DRI.  15CT80:  Count 1 - plea of guilty; Court reviews charge/potential penalties/and elements.  Admits to priors listed in complaint.  15CM42:  will be DRI.  Judge performs plea colloquy with defendant and reviews waiver of rights.  Court finds defendant understands the proceedings and he F,V,K,I, enters his pleas and waives his rights.  Attorney Betthauser stipulates to the facts in the complaint in 16CF44.  Attorney Gardner also stipulates to the facts in the complaints of the other cases.  Finds factual basis exists in each case.  State recommends sentencing as follows:  He will be a participant in the Jackson County Drug Treatment Court.  Withhold sentence on all 4 cases with 5 years probation on each with 1 year on 15CT80.  Primary condition is to successfully complete Adult Treatment court and comply with all rules and regulations set.  He is to report to the Treatment Court Coordinator immediately after reporting to probation agent Heidi Helm after release today.  No additional incarceration recommended at this time.  Must follow all rules of the Court and any other rules of the Treatment Court Team.  Counsel and DA will need to get exact jail credit from the jail.  Attorney Betthauser makes statement to the Court regarding recommendation - agrees with the State.  He believes he has 245 days credit on his case.  Attorney Gardner also agrees with Attorney Betthauser and the State's recommendations and statements.  He believes he should have a total of 503 days credit for all cases.  Defendant exercises his right to allocution.  

Court adopts the recommendations for sentencing, withholds sentence and places on 5 years probation concurrent on 16CF44, 15CF36, and 15CF21 with conditions as follows:   The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Must participate in and successfully complete the Jackson County Treatment Court program and follow all directives of Treatment Court Team.  Must not miss any appointments for any counseling or programming.  Must identify yourself as a Treatment Court participate if you have any contact with law enforcement, dentists, doctors or therapists.  You must submit to random drug testing when requested by your probation agent or the Treatment Court Team.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances.   Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Not to possess any prescription medications of any kind unless those have been prescribed to the defendant by a physician, and in that case, the defendant shall take such medications only as prescribed.  Defendant shall not alter the form of any prescription prior to, or in conjunction with, ingestion.  Not to associate with or be where any illegal drugs are used or sold.  Must have no contact with and drug users or dealers.  Must follow all other recommendations of your probation agent and follow all Department of Corrections rules.  Must undergo an AODA assessment and participate in and successfully complete any recommended treatment or counseling.  Musk seek and maintain employment which is acceptable to your agent and not to leave that employment without the approval of your agent.  Must obtain your GED or HSED .  Must apply for Badgercare or something similar to cover treatment costs.  Must submit a DNA sample and pay the surcharge on all charges.    Credit for 245 days served on 16CF44.

Sentence ordered on 15CT21 - Ct 2:  5 years probation with same conditions plus must perform 100 hours community service which is to be setup with probation agent.  

Sentence ordered on 15CT80 - Ct 1:  1 year probation concurrent, with same conditions as other cases plus no operation of a motor vehicle on the highways in the state of Wisconsin unless properly reinstated.  Bond on file in this case applies to this case first and any balance to apply on other cases.  

15CM42 is dismissed and read-in.  15CF21 - Counts 1,3,4,5 are dismissed and read-in.  15CF36 - Ct 2 is dismissed and read-in.  16CF44 - Counts 3,4,5,6,7 are dismissed and read-in.  16TR1189 is dismissed.
